text: Dude worst mentor ever... I’ve completely dropped the ball here I’m really sorry. Was a bugger of a last few weeks trying to get shots done and I missed your messages! I’ll take a look at this cage now! Hope you’ve had a good Christmas break! Rendering is always a bastard believe me :P

Its looking really nice, the flickering light thats lighting up the back side of the cage is working nicely.

I wonder if the frequency of the flickering light on the Bg and the cage is a bit too much. In yours it feels like its changing quite alot in between each frame. Where as, if you take a look at this video, (god knows what this guy is on about...) <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HQZqbGME5HY> you can see the flicker feels a bit 'slower'

How are creating the effect?

attachments.title: Torches: indoor use
attachments.video_html: <iframe width="400" height="300" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HQZqbGME5HY?feature=oembed&autoplay=1&iv_load_policy=3" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

text:
For the fire, are you using an element or is that from 3D? It feels quite blown out and there isn't much detail in there, it could be worth doing a version where you bring the fire down in luminance a bit and you might read a bit more of the internal movement.

Overall all the pieces are working its just the last few bits!

Haha dude! Don't worry! Hope works eased a little bit for ya now! Yeah my laptop's basically been on all the last 2 weeks rendering and other bits.

Yeah I know exactly where your coming from wth the speed of the flickering. I thought it was too fast but by the time it had finished I just thought can I get away with it to save time :joy:

Using PheonixFD for the fire and just a light with a noise modifier for the lighting. Can easily change the frequency change down a bit to slow the rate of the flickering down. It's just rendering slows everything else down on my poor laptop :joy:

For the fire I was thinking I could replace the fire from pheonix with some stock footage to solve that luminance issue and to add a bit more of a realistic look to it.

Thanks for the feedback btw. 

I'm working on that abandoned street project now. Hoping to have something to show for that on Monday

Ahh amazing, I haven’t used Phoenix before. 

Yeah I know how it is with projects and stuff. At work atm I’m working on a seq that has a load of fire from element shoots and from the guys in FX so I’m a bit tuned in to it :wink: 

Nice that’s all good to hear! Defo let me know if you have any questions about stuff, technical or otherwise too! Hopefully the New Year should be a tiiiiny bit quieter after January as the last Ep of my show (should) deliver by then!
